docs.lead_paragraph: THE graduating class at the Regional Neonatal Intensive-Care Unit of the Westchester County Medical Center will hold its usual, lively graduation exercises on Wednesday. Celebrating its third anniversary as the only regional perinatal center in the seven-county Hudson Valley region, the unit will entertain the Class of 1985 and the parents of its members with a party. All the scores of young guests once entered the Westchester County Medical Center under much different circumstances. Each of these children began life prematurely and was born either at the County Medical Center or was transferred there from one of the 26 hospitals in the region that offer obstetrical services but do not have the facilities or trained staff to monitor the care of newborns weighing one to five pounds. The neonatal unit is awaiting final approval from the state to expand to 30 beds from 22.

headline.main: 3-YEAR-OLD PERINATAL CENTER ON VERGE OF EXPANSION
